title: [BUG] Error while preview artifacts in UI when uploaded to remote machine via FTP
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: **Yes**
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: **Linux Ubuntu 18.04**
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**:  **binary**
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: **1.3.0**
- **Python version**: **3.7**
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**: **normal UI**
- **Exact command to reproduce**: 

mlflow server \
        --backend-store-uri postgresql+pg8000://${POSTGRES_USER}:${POSTGRES_PASSWORD}@project_db:${POSTGRES_PORT}/${POSTGRES_DB} \
        --default-artifact-root ftp://${FTP_USER}:${FTP_PASSWORD}@192.168.178.10/CP_GPU/ML \
        --host 0.0.0.0 \
        --port 5000

The FTP server ist hosted on a synology server.

### Describe the problem
I set up mlflow with a PostgreSQL database as backend store and a FTP location as artifact store. Logging tags, parameters and metrics works without errors. These are also displayed and visualized in the UI.
Only if you want to unfold an artifact folder, you get the MLFlow error page. This happens with every artifact.

### Code to reproduce issue
/

### Other info / logs
There is no error on the log of the server side

Here the logs from the WebConsole:
```
react-dom.production.min.js:151 Error: Can't find child.
    at ArtifactUtils.js:50
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at Function.value (ArtifactUtils.js:46)
    at t.value (ArtifactView.js:190)
    at t.value (ArtifactView.js:57)
    at f (react-dom.production.min.js:131)
    at beginWork (react-dom.production.min.js:138)
    at i (react-dom.production.min.js:176)
    at a (react-dom.production.min.js:176)
    at _ (react-dom.production.min.js:182)
```
Here you see the Scope at the findChild function: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/b47a390356aab3868d0c7299133a82fbdc1ee53e/mlflow/server/js/src/utils/ArtifactUtils.js#L43

In a healthy installation, the path starts after default-artifact-root.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7436938/66049012-e7b07880-e52a-11e9-957d-358386fe34aa.png)
